name: sysadmin_username_sql
description: This is sql login username with sysadmin rights

name: sysadmin_username_win
description: This is the windows username which has sysadmin privileges

name: sysadmin_password_win
description: THIS IS A SENSITIVE FIELD. If left blank, you would be prompted for input during command execution. This is the sysadmin password corresponding to windows user which has sysadmin privileges

name: sysadmin_password_sql
description: THIS IS A SENSITIVE FIELD. If left blank, you would be prompted for input during command execution. This is the sql login password

name: dbserver_description
description: Description of the VM to be created in Prism

name: is_gmsa_sql_service_account
description: change login of instance to gmsa account on the provisioned DB Server

name: sql_login_used
description: If specified true that means you are using sql login with sysadmin rights or else you are using windows username with sysadmin privileges

name: same_as_admin
description: If specified true that means the Windows username also has the sysadmin privileges or else it doesn't

name: instance_name
description: SQL Server instance name to which the Database copy will be attached. Do not change this value if create_dbserver=true

name: create_era_drive
description: If this is specified as 'true', an Era Drive (VG) will be created and mounted under 'era_deploy_base' path. This drive will be used for holding Era software/logs/config and also as a staging location for database logs. If it is specified as 'false', no new Era Drive (VG) will be created. Instead, the 'era_deploy_base' directory will be used for parking Era software/logs/config and the Database staging logs

name: era_deploy_base
description: DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE. Base installation directory for ERA agent.

name: vm_password
description: THIS IS A SENSITIVE FIELD. If left blank, you would be prompted for input during command execution. Password of the dbserver VM. Either the password or the ssh_private_key have to be provided

name: working_dir
description: A temporary directory which will be used to stage scripts and other artifacts. It will be deleted at the end of the cloning process. Example: /tmp, /var/opt/tmp, C:\temp, etc
